content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 3 is:

2 -> 4 -> 12

Please note that this is the shortest path from node 2 to node 3 and it is different from the reverse path from node 3 to node 2. If you have swapped the start and end points of the problem, the shortest path should be different.

The shortest path from node 3 to node 2 is:

3 -> 11 -> 12

Again, this is the shortest path from node 3 to node 2 and it is different from the reverse path from node 2 to node 3. If you have swapped the start and end points of the problem, the shortest path should be different.
